messages: 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (14:53): Hixie: "This example creates a big list with a nested list for each item on the page, each with of all the property names used in that item./p>" markup typo
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (14:54): a markup error that a validator wouldn't catch :(
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (14:55): nor a spell-checker, presumably
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:55): But you'd catch it when reading the page
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (14:56): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: after having done markup validation, you'd expect you would have caught all markup errors
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (14:59): maybe a validator could issue a warning if there was a ">" before an implied tag, or similar
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:59): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: Your expectation would be wrong, however
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (14:59): clearly
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (15:00): i'd like to know if it's possible to make it right a bit more often, though
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:00): wonders ho "kind" means something like "property"
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:01): looks for synonyms
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:01): We could replace it with the "realestate" attribute
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:02): Since we already have a "subject" attribute, property could be renamed to "predicate"
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:03): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: Noooooooooooooooooooo
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:04): Since the attribute is determining how the value is related to the item, it could be called "rel"
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:04): Tip 1 for writing a usable markup language: don't use natural language words that most native speakers of the natural langauge don't understand
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:05): as part of the language
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:07): Everyone should know what predicates are! You can't even do higher-order logic without them
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:07): As gsnedders would say]
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (15:10): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: your impl doesn't generate a triple for the <title>
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:12): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: See line 186 or thereabouts
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:12): // TODO: title
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (15:14): notes that RDF uses title.textContent while document.title uses just the <title>s child text nodes
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:19): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: (Added title)
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (15:21): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: i get <> dct:title "HTML 5 microdata demo" . regardless of what i write as input
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:22): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: That's because that's the first title element on the page
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (15:22): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: maybe you could use an iframe?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:23): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: Then I'd have to figure out how to make jQuery give me elements from within that iframe instead of the current document
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (15:24): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: you could replace title[0] with title[1]
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:25): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: I'd prefer to be implementing what the spec says, so any bugs are in the demo setup rather than in the parser code
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (15:29): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: btw http://simon.html5.org/tools/js/innerhtml-viewer/getInnerHTML.js has an ascii-lowercase function
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:34): function toAsciiLowerCase(input) {return input.replace(/[A-Z]/g, function(char) {return char.toLowerCase()})}
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:36): Hmph, '_:n2 c:org.w3.name "HTML5" .' isn't valid because it's not a proper QName
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:37): or something like that
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:37): http://www.rdfabout.com/demo/validator/ complains "Invalid token" so I assume it's right and I'm wrong
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:40): wwonders how he got spidermonkey to fill up empty array elements with characters
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:40): doing something like ["a", "b"].concat(["c",,"d"])
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:49): N3 output should now be correcter
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:50): and conciser
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:50): except for the bits that had to become verboser in order to be correcter
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (15:55): c:org.w3.name is not a proper QName?

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:56): It's not a proper "QName or something like that", where the "something" is (([A-Z_a-z?Ä-?ñ?ò-????-ÀøÕ?-Õ?Õø-·øø‚Äå-‚Äç‚Å?-‚Üè‚?Ä-‚øØ„ÄÅ-ÌüøÔ§Ä-Ô?èÔ??-Ôø??êÄÄ-ÛØøø][\-0-9A-Z_a-z¬??Ä-?ñ?ò-????-Õ?Õø-·øø‚Äå-‚Äç‚Äø-‚ÅÄ‚Å?-‚Üè‚?Ä-‚øØ„ÄÅ-ÌüøÔ§Ä-Ô?èÔ??-Ôø??êÄÄ-ÛØøø]*)?:)?[A-Z_a-z?Ä-?ñ?ò-????-ÀøÕ?-Õ?Õø-·øø‚Äå-‚Äç‚Å?-‚Üè‚?Ä-‚øØ„ÄÅ-ÌüøÔ§Ä-Ô?èÔ??-Ôø??êÄÄ-ÛØøø][\-0-9A-Z_a-z¬??Ä-?ñ?ò-????-Õ?Õø-·øø‚Äå-‚Äç‚Äø-‚ÅÄ‚Å?-‚Üè‚?Ä-‚øØ„ÄÅ-ÌüøÔ§Ä-Ô?èÔ??-Ôø??êÄÄ-ÛØøø]*
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:56): according to http://www.w3.org/2000/10/swap/grammar/n3-report.html
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (15:57): so no dots
c3b830f9a769b49d3250795223caad4d (15:57): is audio element still around? wondered why it wasn't in microdata additions like img, object, video, & a are
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (15:58): it's still around
c3b830f9a769b49d3250795223caad4d (15:58): thought so
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:58): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: Lots of dots, but not "." in particular
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:59): c3b830f9a769b49d3250795223caad4d: Sounds like an oversight
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:59): c3b830f9a769b49d3250795223caad4d: Seems like it makes as much sense as <video> so probably an omisssion
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:59): accidential omission
c3b830f9a769b49d3250795223caad4d (15:59): can someone pls mention to Hixie......not gonna online rest of day
c3b830f9a769b49d3250795223caad4d (16:00): be online, that is

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:00): but I guess Hixie will read the IRC logs anyway

73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (16:02): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: maybe you should not use any prefixes to prevent such bugs?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:02): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: That would make it unnecessarily hard to read
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:04): Also, I don't care much about bugs - readability is more useful
